item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, December 19, 2024 at 3:25 AM UTC
item.description:
1. There's No Such Thing as Software Productivity (2012) (54 points | 34 comments)
2. Solaar is a Linux manager for many Logitech keyboards, mice, and other devices (267 points | 118 comments)
3. Show HN: Postgres as a VectorDB GUI (4 points | 1 comment)
4. Self-sorting arrays reveal unexpected competencies in minimal intelligence (52 points | 3 comments)
5. Embedding Lua in Sqleibniz with Rust (29 points | 1 comment)
6. Error Stacking in Rust (10 points | 2 comments)
7. ISO 8583: The language of credit cards (210 points | 34 comments)
8. Cultural Evolution of Cooperation Among LLM Agents (220 points | 109 comments)
9. Half My Life with Perl – By Randal Schwartz (10 points | discuss)
10. Launch HN: Innate (YC F24) – Home robots as easy to program as AI agents (116 points | 58 comments)
11. The RAM Myth (39 points | 15 comments)
12. Piccolo OS, a Small Multitasking OS for the Raspberry Pi Pico (10 points | discuss)
13. Updates to H-1B (269 points | 759 comments)
14. The unbearable slowness of being: Why do we live at 10 bits/s? (252 points | 278 comments)
15. Our brains create mental "chapters" with new event segmentation study (18 points | 2 comments)
16. Corvus Robotics (YC S18) is hiring a Head of Software to help inventory drones ( | hide)
17. Windshield pitting incidents in Washington reach fever pitch on April 15, 1954 (2003) (253 points | 180 comments)
18. Apple Watch with Android (120 points | 66 comments)
19. Automotive Grade Linux Launches New Expert Group Led by Toyota (5 points | discuss)
20. I Built a Figma Plugin That Generates Custom SVG Illustrations with AI (17 points | 3 comments)
21. The moonbit compiler is available on GitHub (15 points | 7 comments)
22. Advanced Civilizations Could Be Indistinguishable from Nature (30 points | 11 comments)
23. "The Custer Wolf is Dead." (1921) [pdf] (35 points | 5 comments)
24. Java in the Small (200 points | 139 comments)
25. Formally Modeling Dreidel, the Sequel (79 points | 22 comments)
26. Moon (2830 points | 235 comments)
27. CDC confirms first severe human case of bird flu in U.S. (150 points | 42 comments)
28. Consider the Shipwreck: Ten Books on Maritime Disasters and Ecological Collapse (13 points | 2 comments)
29. BlackSheep: Fast ASGI web framework for Python (42 points | 30 comments)
30. On-silicon real-time AI compute governance from Nvidia, Intel, EQTY Labs (31 points | 24 comments)
